titlStmt.titl: Mapping and Expanding Library Classification for Marginalized Domains: Feminism as a Prototype

citation.biblCit: Olsen, Hope A.; Ward, Dennis B., 2015, "Mapping and Expanding Library Classification for Marginalized Domains: Feminism as a Prototype", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10616, UAL Dataverse, V1

titlStmt.titl: Mapping and Expanding Library Classification for Marginalized Domains: Feminism as a Prototype

AuthEnty.affiliation: School of Library and Information Studies, University of Alberta

rspStmt.AuthEnty: Olsen, Hope A.; Ward, Dennis B.

stdyInfo.abstract: This demonstration database and accompanying questionnaire represent the final stage of a research project to map and expand library classification, specifically the Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC), for more equitable and appropriate coverage of marginalized subject areas. The database is intended to assist libraries that seek improved classification of women's studies and feminist materials, especially those with specialized collections in the area.

othrStdyMat.relMat: Ward, Dennis B. and Hope A. Olson. (1998) A Shelf Browsing Search System for Marginalized User Groups. In "Information access in the global information economy: Proceedings of the 61st annual meeting of the American Society for Information Science, October 25-29, 1998, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania" (pp. 342-347). Medford, NJ: Information Today, Inc. Kublik, Angela, Virginia Clevette, Dennis B. Ward and Hope A. Olson. (in press) "Adapting dominant classifications to particular contexts." Cataloging and Classification Quarterly.

otherMat.txt: Compressed folder of files used to build and update the "women" database
Compressed folder of files that implement the user interface to the databases
